channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2023070125
item.description:
Report E-2023070125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a UN3267 EDTA Acid Tetrasodium Salt 38% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 4' x 10' area of the trailer floor and a 4' x 10' area of the concrete lot below due to the tote being punctured by the trailer wall. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one and absorbents were deployed to clean all impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070121
item.description:
Report E-2023070121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: LANTAU HONG KONG
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS TRANSITING THROUGH HONG KONG FROM GUAM TO THE USA WHEN A DANGEROUS GOODS WAS DISCOVERED. OUTER BOX IS A PLASTIC PELICAN CASE CONTAINING MULTIPLE OFFICE SUPPLIES INCLUDING ONE X TEN OZ CAN OF INNOVERA DUSTER CLASSIFIED AS UN3159, REFRIGERANT GAS R134A. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON A UPS FLIGHT FROM GUAM TO DISCOVERY IN HONG KONG. THE TRACKING THERMAL LABEL DESCRIPTION IS FEMA EMERGENCY EQUIPMENT. INVOICE DESCRIPTION IS FEMA IMAT EQUIPMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PELICAN CASE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FORM GUAM USING UPS ACCOUNT 30250R, DHS FEMA REGION IX, 1111 BROADWAY, OAKLAND, CA 94607.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal ULV experienced a UN1993 Hydrite Blend 6 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to the trailer floor and a 50' x 20' area of the concrete lot below. The area was secured with boom and all released product was collected with absorbents. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. All impacted absorbents, boom, and cleanup debris were containerized into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070126
item.description:
Report E-2023070126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, at 0400 EST, XPO Logistics Terminal LSL experienced a UN3264 “Sure Klean 600” release from a 5-gallon poly jug due to a pallet puncture impacting the trailer floor and concrete lot below. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup operations. On June 30, 2023, at 0723 EST, contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately all 5-gallons of product released from the jug impacting an 8’ x 20’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. Three impacted pallets were cut up and containerized along with the empty jug and impacted absorbents. The waste was placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28, 2023, at 05 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Richmond Hill, Georgia regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of Aluma-Brite (Corrosive liquids, toxic, n.o.s., (Hydrofluoric Acid, Hydrochloric Acid, Phosphoric Acid), UN2922, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The release was reportedly due to a loose bung. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The loose bung was tightened and the drum was forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite for proper disposal by the contractors.

item.description:
Report E-2023070087

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading a straight truck at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI, a 15 gallon steel drum fell over. As the drum fell, the contents of the drum shifted and created a spark which resulted in the lid shooting off. The Veolia employees offloading the truck witnessed a ball of light come from the drum. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the drum contained multiple lead acid batteries which were not protected from short circuiting as well as two luminous tube transformers. This incident resulted in a vapor release only, due to pressure build up with the drum. No amount hazard material was released as a result of the incident.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of hydrogen peroxide was punctured and released less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazMat Special Services (HMSS) to remediate the site. The 330-gallon tote of hydrogen peroxide had sustained damage to the top, but less than one (<1) gallon had released to the trailer. HMSS personnel utilized absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted trailer floor. HMSS personnel then transferred the product from the 330-gallon tote to another 330-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one (1) vented poly drum along with the used absorbent pads. This drum was staged on-site in the terminal's waste holding room for further evaluation.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to the spill office located at our hub facility located in Memphis TN when moisture and staining was seen indicating leakage from inside. Package consisted of a fibreboard box containing 13 glass bottles. Each bottle was wrapped in a plastic moisture barrier and bubble wrap was used for dunnage. It was seen one of the glass bottles was broken and allowed for .5L of UN1307 Xylenes. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for return to shipper as FedEx policy does not for international shipment of salvage packaging.

  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sulfuric acid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted surface. AS identified the damaged pail and solidified the remaining contents in one (1) 30-gallon drum. AS deployed absorbents to the product on the concrete and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids in a separate 30-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled by R+L personnel

item.description:
Report E-2023070026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: Coldfoot
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WEAVER BROS., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A semi tractor was driving northbound on the Dalton Highway around Mile 126, approaching a curve that is colloquially referred to among Alaskan truck drivers as "Oh Shit Corner". The driver entered the corner at excessive speed, and immediately before the corner struck a large pothole in the road, which apparently caused two trailer tires to blow out, contributing to the loss of control in the corner. The tractor trailer combination rolled onto its side and departed the roadway, coming to rest beside and below the highway grade. The driver received only minor injuries and did not require transport for medical attention. At the time of the initial response, Alaska Commercial Vehicle Compliance and Alaska State Troopers believed there may have been a release due to the odor, however Suburban Propane (shipper) personnel arrived on the scene and reported there was no leak beyond normal vent operation. Personnel and equipment were mobilized to the scene, the product was transloaded into another tanker, and a wrecker removed the tractor and trailer and brought them back to Fairbanks. Professional traffic control allowed this to be completed without requiring a road closure.

item.title: Report E-2023070022
item.description:
Report E-2023070022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Allied International Emergency was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft- by-10ft area of the terminal floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging eighteen (18) 1-gallon plastic jugs. Allied International Emergency personnel separated the non-damaged plastic jugs and placed them on the side to be shipped onto the consignee. Allied International Emergency personnel neutralized the impacted area and deployed granular absorbents to collect the released material. Allied International Emergency personnel gathered all spent material and debris placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The impacted pallet was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The empty plastic jugs were placed into an additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3082 CRODATERIC CAS 50-LQ-(MH) release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the dock floor and a 20' x 24' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The material was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.description:

  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAQ experienced an over the road release of UN1760 Clothesline Fresh BLD Detergent from (3) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 1' x 1' area of the gravel/soil below. Citric acid & oil dri were deployed to clean impacted areas. The impacted soil was shoveled up and backfilled. The damaged pails and cleanup debris were then placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

  • Description: The rear axle of the trailer overheated causing a fire which spread to the tires. The fire could not be extinguished and it burnt the sides of the trailer engulfing the trailer in fire. The fire spread to the tractor and it also burned. The fire on and under the trailer heated the fire protection system in the trailer causing it to trigger. The fire protection system is intended to release the contents of the trailer to the atmosphere to prevent rupture of the pressure vessels. The gas vented to the atmosphere and ignited from the nearby fire for approximately 45 minutes.

  • Description: To be clear, there was nothing wrong with the valves on our trailer, I just didn't know what to flag on number 25. That said our driver hooked up to the right fill line at the customer (nitric acid) but then when he turned around to our trailer he ended up to the wrong compartment which contained sodium hydroxide. He admits that he didn't do a final check like they are trained to do. When he started to unload smoke quickly formed from the customer tank. He shut down. The reaction caused approximately 10 gallons to leak on to the concrete floor. A clean up crew was hired to come in and clean up the floor and empty the tank when the reaction subsided.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1170 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed the leaking 55-gallon drum had been placed on its side to prevent any further leaking. One (1) gallon of ethanol solution was estimated to have released to the dock floor. AS personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ethanol solution-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. The leaking 55-gallon drum and the collected spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. This overpack was labeled with a "hazardous" label and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: On June 13, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of UN3266 appeared to be defective and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. HES personnel arrived and assessed the site. The amount of product released was so small, it had only impacted the cardboard box, and the product had already dried, so R+L personnel wanted to ship the product as is. HES personnel identified the cause of the leak as the lids not being properly screwed on. Crews tightened the lids and tested them to see that they did not leak any further

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading a truck at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Phoenix, AZ, Veolia employees observed a 275 gallon tote to be leaking. Further investigation revealed there was corrosion to the floor pan of the tote that rusted enough to create a sharp edge. The sharp edge punctured the bottom of the tote's bladder resulting in a release of material from the tote. The contents of the tote were transferred to a new tote for continued transportation. Spill pads were used by Veolia personnel to cleanup the released material. It is believed that the corrosion was likely due to the tote being staged/stored outside at the shipper's location.

  • Description: On June 13, 2023, three (3) 25-pound bags of low temp salt oxidizer were damaged by improper shipper handling and released approximately five (5) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbent pads, degreaser, and hepa vac to the red pigment-impacted trailer interior and collected them. All spent absorbent pads and vac liner were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • City: HOLMES MILL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: ERGON TRUCKING, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Traveling southwest on KY-38, MM24-25, Tractor and Trailer dropped off narrow berm of road and rolled over embankment into creek. The rollover resulted in rupturing the shell of the trailer and releasing approximately 113 bbls. of crude oil into ditch/creek. A rock in the creek is believed to be what punctured the shell of the aluminum trailer. Kentucky Emergency Response Branch as well as Kentucky Department of Environmental Protection were notified immediately. Contract Spill Response/Cleanup company (EcoTech Environmental USA) was contacted with a response time of roughly two hours. Onsite EMS services responded by inserting a wooden wedge plug into the shell of trailer along with a putty sealant to slow the leakage of product. Kentucky Emergency Management Report #20232450 Kentucky Department of Environmental Protection #2518189

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UKC experienced a battery acid release from an 1830-pound UN2794 Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 3' x 10' area of the trailer floor and concrete dock due to the battery falling over as a result of a pallet failure. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The battery was wiped down and re-secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: ON June 1st, a package containing UN3264, Corrosive Liquid, Acid, Inorganic, n.o.s.(), 8, II was found to be leaking. Upon opening the package it was found that it contained three plastic bottles, with one of the bottles having opened and its contents leaking out. Secondary containment inside the package was minimal. The remaining shipment was put into a salvage stum and an amended shippers dec was asked for in order to sent the rest of the shipment on.

  • Description: On 5/16 at approximately 9:30 AM around 90 gis. of Caustic 50% being transferred from the rail car into the storage tank was released. The release was caused by the tank being over-filled. The lead operator mis-judged how much space was remaining in the tank. The second operator panicked and did not remember where the shut off valve was. By the time the lead operator was alerted approximately 90 gallons was released into the tank farm's dike.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/24/2023 at approximately 1945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3801288 at a station location in Phoenix , reporting an spilling involving an undeclared corrosive liquid. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, each containing two plastic contaiiners of liquid. Upon discovery, one of the boxes appeared damp on the bottom. Further investigation revealed the screw top on one of the containers had loosened, causing the contents to completely spill. The attached safety data sheet idenetified the commodity as UN 1760. Neither of the package were prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations as they were missing the marking, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The entire shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.
